page.title: 14EVENTS
page.content: {CHARLIE'S ANGELS. TUESDAY,23RD APRIL 1985 SAW CWMGWRACH FESTOONED WITH FLAGS,PEOPLE LINING THE STREETS AND WE IN SCHOOL CRAMMED AGAINST THE RAILINGS TO GIVE A TREMENDOUS WELCOME TO OUR LOCAL ST. JOHN'S AMBULANCE TEAM.THEY HAD WON THE COMMONWEALTH CENTENARY COMPETITION IN CHRISTCHURCH,NEW ZEALAND. {THE INVITATION TO COMPETE IN NEW {ZEALAND WAS THE RESULT OF HAVING WON {THE BRITISH AMBULANCE COMPETITION {THREE YEARS IN SUCCESSION.} IN WINNING THE COMPETITION THE GLYNNEATH TEAM DEFEATED TEAMS FROM ENGLAND,NEW ZEALAND,AUSTRALIA,HONG KONG,SRI LANKA AND FIJI. THEY ALSO WON THE TEAM MEMBERS TROPHY AND THE CAPTAIN'S CUP. THE TROPHIES WERE PRESENTED BY THE DUKE AND DUCHESS OF GLOUCESTER.
